title: A List Of Countries With Confirmed Cases Of New Mpox Variant
content: The World Health Organization declared mpox a global public health emergency for the second time in two years, following an outbreak of the viral infection in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has spread to neighbouring countries.
summary: The World Health Organization declared mpox a global public health emergency for the second time in two years, following an outbreak of the viral infection in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has spread to neighbouring countries.

title: China's Rocket Debris May Stay In Orbit For Decades, Experts Warn
content: Despite China's assurances on debris mitigation, experts worry about the growing risk from such incidents, emphasizing the need for better international regulation.
summary: Despite China's assurances on debris mitigation, experts worry about the growing risk from such incidents, emphasizing the need for better international regulation.

title: Biden Asked Netanyahu To Pull Israeli Troops From Egypt-Gaza Border: Report
content: U.S. President Joe Biden asked Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to move Israeli troops back from Gaza's border with Egypt as part of an initial phase of a ceasefire deal so that talks could continue, Axios reported on Friday.
summary: U.S. President Joe Biden asked Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to move Israeli troops back from Gaza's border with Egypt as part of an initial phase of a ceasefire deal so that talks could continue, Axios reported on Friday.

title: US Sanctions 400 More Targets For Aiding Russia's War Effort
content: The United States unveiled sweeping sanctions Friday against almost 400 individuals and companies tied to Russia's war in Ukraine, a day before Ukraine's independence day.
summary: The United States unveiled sweeping sanctions Friday against almost 400 individuals and companies tied to Russia's war in Ukraine, a day before Ukraine's independence day.

title: China's Export Strategy Causes Global Market Havoc: Report
content: Chinas aggressive manufacturing and export strategy under Xi Jinping, driven by the "establish the new before breaking the old" policy, is intensifying global trade tensions.
summary: Chinas aggressive manufacturing and export strategy under Xi Jinping, driven by the "establish the new before breaking the old" policy, is intensifying global trade tensions.

title: All About BHISHM Cubes - Mobile Hospitals From India To War-Hit Ukraine
content: PM Modi Ukraine Visit: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today offered indigenously developed four BHISHM (Bharat Health Initiative for Sahyog Hita and Maitri) Cubes to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during his visit to the war-torn country.
summary: PM Modi Ukraine Visit: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today offered indigenously developed four BHISHM (Bharat Health Initiative for Sahyog Hita and Maitri) Cubes to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during his visit to the war-torn country.

title: Pakistan Reports 16th Polio Case Of 2024, To Launch Vaccination Campaign
content: Pakistan reported another case of poliovirus after a child was paralysed in the Sindh province, increasing the country's total tally to 16 in 2024, an official told the media on Friday.
summary: Pakistan reported another case of poliovirus after a child was paralysed in the Sindh province, increasing the country's total tally to 16 in 2024, an official told the media on Friday.

title: Ex-Hollywood Actor With 109 Convictions Jailed For Assaulting Ex-Girlfriend
content: The incident, captured on a doorbell camera, took place in Newcastle on December 11, 2023, and violated an existing restraining order against Hoganson.
summary: The incident, captured on a doorbell camera, took place in Newcastle on December 11, 2023, and violated an existing restraining order against Hoganson.

title: "Progress Made": White House On High-Stakes Gaza Truce Talks Held In Cairo
content: Talks in Cairo on reaching a Gaza truce have made progress, the White House said Friday, as it urged Israel and Hamas to move forward.
summary: Talks in Cairo on reaching a Gaza truce have made progress, the White House said Friday, as it urged Israel and Hamas to move forward.

title: 11 dead, 14 Missing After Heavy Rains Trigger Floods In China: Report
content: Eleven people have been killed and 14 more are missing after heavy rain in recent days lashed China's northeastern province of Liaoning, state broadcaster CCTV reported Friday.
summary: Eleven people have been killed and 14 more are missing after heavy rain in recent days lashed China's northeastern province of Liaoning, state broadcaster CCTV reported Friday.

title: Child Among 7 Killed As Israel Strikes Lebanon Amid High Tensions: Report
content: Israeli airstrikes across southern Lebanon on Friday killed at least six fighters and one child, according to security sources, as armed group Hezbollah responded with artillery rounds and rockets across the border.
summary: Israeli airstrikes across southern Lebanon on Friday killed at least six fighters and one child, according to security sources, as armed group Hezbollah responded with artillery rounds and rockets across the border.

title: 8 Killed As Russia Strikes Ukraine Again, Say Authorities
content: Russian strikes killed eight civilians across Ukraine, regional authorities announced Friday, over two years and a half since Russia invaded its neighbour.
summary: Russian strikes killed eight civilians across Ukraine, regional authorities announced Friday, over two years and a half since Russia invaded its neighbour.

title: "Don't Have Political Strategy To...": India's Jab On Russian Oil Question
content: India - one of the world's biggest consumers of crude oil - does not have a "political strategy" that informs its purchases, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar said at a press conference in Kyiv, shortly after Prime Minister Modi met President Zelensky.
summary: India - one of the world's biggest consumers of crude oil - does not have a "political strategy" that informs its purchases, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar said at a press conference in Kyiv, shortly after Prime Minister Modi met President Zelensky.

title: Lufthansa Extends Beirut Flight Suspension Amid High Middle East Tensions
content: German airline giant Lufthansa said Friday it was extending a suspension of flights to Beirut until September 30 and to Tel Aviv and Tehran until September 2 with regional tensions still high.
summary: German airline giant Lufthansa said Friday it was extending a suspension of flights to Beirut until September 30 and to Tel Aviv and Tehran until September 2 with regional tensions still high.

title: Baby Paralysed In Gaza's First Case Of Type 2 Polio For 25 Years: WHO
content: A 10-month-old baby in war-shattered Gaza has been paralysed by the type 2 polio virus, the first such case in the territory in 25 years, the World Health Organization said on Friday, with U.N. agencies appealing for urgent vaccinations of every baby
summary: A 10-month-old baby in war-shattered Gaza has been paralysed by the type 2 polio virus, the first such case in the territory in 25 years, the World Health Organization said on Friday, with U.N. agencies appealing for urgent vaccinations of every baby

title: WHO Says Partners Can Start Talks To Buy Mpox Vaccines Before Approval
content: The World Health Organization said on Friday its partners like Gavi and Unicef can start buying mpox vaccines before they are approved in a bid to get inoculations to Africa faster as the continent battles an escalating outbreak of the virus.
summary: The World Health Organization said on Friday its partners like Gavi and Unicef can start buying mpox vaccines before they are approved in a bid to get inoculations to Africa faster as the continent battles an escalating outbreak of the virus.

title: Women To Cover Faces, Men To Grow Beards: Taliban Codify Morality Laws
content: Afghanistan's Taliban formally codified a long set of rules governing morality this week, ranging from requiring women to cover their faces and men to grow beards to banning car drivers from playing music, the Justice Ministry said.
summary: Afghanistan's Taliban formally codified a long set of rules governing morality this week, ranging from requiring women to cover their faces and men to grow beards to banning car drivers from playing music, the Justice Ministry said.

title: "Maximum Alert" In Gabon After First Case Of Mpox Detected
content: Gabon has reported its first case of mpox in a man who had returned from a trip to Uganda, its health ministry said. Cases of the infectious disease, formerly known as monkeypox, have been surging in East Africa, but have also been detected in Asia.
summary: Gabon has reported its first case of mpox in a man who had returned from a trip to Uganda, its health ministry said. Cases of the infectious disease, formerly known as monkeypox, have been surging in East Africa, but have also been detected in Asia.

title: Russian Court Imprisons 5 Men Over Anti-Israel Riots At Dagestan Airport
content: A court in southern Russia on Friday sentenced five men to more than six years in prison each in the first convictions related to a mass anti-Israel protest last October at an airport in the predominantly Muslim Dagestan region.
summary: A court in southern Russia on Friday sentenced five men to more than six years in prison each in the first convictions related to a mass anti-Israel protest last October at an airport in the predominantly Muslim Dagestan region.

title: UK Tycoon's Daughter Is Seventh, Final Victim Of Sicily Yacht Sinking
content: Divers searching a sunken superyacht off Sicily recovered the body of the teenage daughter of UK tech tycoon Mike Lynch Friday, the seventh and final victim of a tragedy in which the businessman also perished.
summary: Divers searching a sunken superyacht off Sicily recovered the body of the teenage daughter of UK tech tycoon Mike Lynch Friday, the seventh and final victim of a tragedy in which the businessman also perished.
